pros: The Support Center has solid resources for the nursing team
cons: Challenging work during difficult economic pressures

review_title: An opportunity to serve vulnerable seniors
pros: Providing basic shelter and services for low-income seniors
cons: The corporate culture is the most disorientingly toxic environment I have ever worked in. Several other professionals have shared this strong sentiment with me. Leadership, while standing behind the claim of of a Christian company (leading work meetings with prayer, etc) are dishonest, racist, retaliatory in fully illegal ways, and incompetent bullies. The casual yet pervasive dishonesty of this faith-based group can’t be overstated. The residents and hard working site employees deserve better.

job_title: Business Office Manager in Louisville, KY
pros: The residents and co-workers are great
cons: The health benefits and sick days are lacking

pros: You're always mean to feel appreciated at bridgepoint. Quick to address the problem if there are any.
cons: My main con with bridgepoint is there's not a lot of consistency in the training

pros: CCC Middletown is a smaller, family-like community. Residents feel at home and are well cared for by an exceptional caregiving staff. The staff has been here for many years, with tenured stability--rare in today's senior living market. Christian Care Communities shows they care for their staff by providing extra benefits beyond salary and supports staff members with emergency needs (i.e.--tornado victims, etc.). Staff members pray for each other and stick together in tough times. CCC invests in the professional development and career advancement of staff, which empowers them to better serve residents. Their Program Support Center is invaluable in helping with the "back office" functions of operation for 10 communities statewide, making it easier to concentrate on serving the local staff and residents.
cons: CCC is a non-profit, so resources are sometimes stretched thinner than for-profit competitors. However, CCC is also a mission-driven vs. profit driven organization, which translates into better support of employees and better care for residents.

pros:

Free soft drinks
Amazing residents
cons:

review_title: Grateful for Healthcare and Senior Living Team
pros: The organization is truly grateful for their healthcare and senior living hero’s and does their best to respond to their needs
cons: All work is challenging during these unprecedented times

review_title: Need and ready for a change
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Louisville, KY
pros: Great therapy department both physical and occupational
cons: Not enough pay.Too indecisive hey to do something this way today in a different way tomorrow. Not caring of employees

pros:
Helping the residents & enriching their lives
There is a great sisterhood amongst the employees, having worked together for many years.
cons: Management has not given their Healthcare workers any hourly wage increase at any time during Covid 19. It is discouraging to say the least, as the name Christian Care should imply the company cares enough to pay their employees a living wage. Top management is receiving 4x the living wage.

pros: Flexible schedule, supportive work environment, and very nice residents
cons: Honestly, I didn’t have any problems working here

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Bowling Green, KY
pros: Management is great, good hours, understanding staff
cons: Long hours and short staffed

review_title: Fair pay, excellent leadership and management, purpose and community.
pros: I have been a chaplain with Christian Care Communities for nearly three years. I feel a sense of belonging with the company. Not only have I made life-long friends, but I'm getting to be a huge part of the residents' lives by being their chaplain, pastor, and spiritual leader. I have been blessed by this company in many ways and hope to be a chaplain here for many years to come.
cons: Currently none at this time.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Hopkinsville, KY
pros: Amazing Residents who love you like a grandchild
cons: Not enough staffing at all

pros: Great place to gain experience and wonderful residents to work with
cons: Have to cook and do patient care sometimes without help.

pros: The mission of service to seniors and caring for their needs as they age is personally rewarding.
cons: Caring for seniors is a 24/7/365 so taking well-being breaks is important for a long satisfying career

pros: CCC is comprised of a staff that is caring, committed, and competent and puts the needs of our Elders first.
cons: To date I have not experienced any negatives regarding working for CCC

pros: The residents and families we support at this stage in their lives, make this more than an occupation, this is a rewarding career when you can help others in difficult transitions
cons: Communication within this company is not always what it should be

pros: This is a great company to work for with rich history of putting value in their employees. Wonderful team members make CCC a wonder family oriented workplace.
cons: It's difficult to list any... Every job has it's cons, but the pros out way to cons by a landslide.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Louisville, KY
pros: Faith based mission for patients, residents and employees. Co-workers are all one big family.
cons: Salary and lack of resources.

job_title: Development and Raiser's Edge Specialist in Louisville, KY
pros: Great atmosphere. They live the company mission. Wonderful co-workers.
cons: There are no cons working at Christian Care.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Louisville, KY
pros: there are not any pros
cons: Company ran from the top down, no room for growth.

review_title: To much drama not enough help
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Bowling Green, KY
pros: Faith based that’s about it. The place went to hell in a hand basket.
cons:
Drama 
Not enough help
To many changes

pros: There are none. Patients lay in broken outdated beds, bed sores out of control because they hire lazy staff, the rooms are not rehab friendly when it comes to tubes and machines plug ups.
cons: It’s basically a con, pay is not consistent with the cost of living, management care more about keeping cost down and keeping bonuses than paying employees a living wage. Bed bugs all throughout the facility. It’s been brought to management more than once, nurses are extremely lazy and most don’t move until a patient is close to death, too many patients dying on rehab floor which makes no sense for a rehab unit, so many state and federal violations it’s mind boggling, stingy with supplies to keep cost down but they don’t mind charging $75 for a ham sandwich and some chips. They take any patient even if they can’t care for that patient correctly just to milk their insurance, if the nursing board ok Kentucky is reading this please shut down this facility.

review_title: I'm saying YES, to Christian Care Communities
pros: Christian Care is very family oriented.  They have been very caring and accommodating with my schedule when family concerns and health issues have arose.  They have also helped me further my education in my field.
cons: Being a nonprofit organization and competing with others that are not, make it hard to keep good people.  Training new people causes a break in our schedules; we don't want to slight our residents.

pros: The work is very rewarding and the team approach to caring for seniors 24/7 is very effective.  This industry has a lot of amazing opportunities to grow your career from direct care to administration.  I like having clear goals and being able to celebrate those achievements with my co-workers.
cons: There are great opportunities to succeed but the day is full of disruptions which can be a challenge to manage.  At the end of the day, I feel good about the work and helping seniors enjoy your lives at Christian Care.

pros: My experience with Christian Care Communities has been great! The leadership team and co-workers are the most genuine people to work with. I enjoy my job and appreciate the opportunity to work for an organization that has been in existence for 130+ years.
cons: I don't know what to say for a con... the job is demanding, but every position has challenges. Nothing really bad to say.

pros: Working with seniors can be immensely rewarding. Every person has a story to tell and it is an honor to get to know them, serve them, and learn from them.
cons: Extremely high turnover due to a lack of respect and poor treatment of employees. Can be verbally abusive and a hostile work environment. Lack of straight answers to direct questions. Job description and promises didn't match daily expectations at all.

pros: It is a joy to walk through the door every day.  I believe in and support the Mission:  To enhance the journey of life for Older Adults.  My co-workers are dedicated, focused and creative.  I am inspired by working with the first female President and CEO of Christian Care Communities.   I love my job.
cons: I really cannot think of any cons about this organization.

review_title: Outdated care practices and no proactive preventative measures taken.
pros: Provides health insurance & a competitive wage.
cons: There is no opportunity for career growth. Practice reactive nursing rather than proactive. Excellence in care is neither recognized, praised or encouraged.

pros: This is a company that lives up to their mission vision and values!  Everyone is here for the right reason- our residents that we serve each and everyday.
cons: There are times that are stressful and you're super busy, but that's when you rely on your team for help.  No one is ever too busy to pull together for the common goal.

pros: Wonderful people, always willing to help answer a question or show you how to do something.  Care for our seniors is always the #1 concern.  Nice to come to work and see smiling faces!
cons: A lot of work to keep up with but isn't like that everywhere now.  Management understands that and makes adjustments as needed.

pros: It's great to work for an organization that considers it's mission in all decisions, and is transparent in sharing information with employees.  Wouldn't want to work any where else!
cons: Sometimes the hill we climb feels a bit steep, but we persevere in the interest of the organization, employees, and the families we serve.

pros: I have worked 20+ years for Christian Care and know they are conscientious; the management cares about their employees, and provides all the tools needed for a successful career.  They truly care for their residents and clients, too.
cons: Due to recent program expansions has created a much busier work environment.

pros: Easy Going. Fun environment. Coworkers treat you like family. Decent benefits and competitive pay. Smaller company.
cons: Vacation and sick time accrual is very low.

job_title: Business Office Liaison in Corbin, KY
pros: I love working here. It’s a great environment. The staff get along and work well together. They offer paid time off, health insurance, 401K and life insurance.
cons: It can be stressful at times, but that’s life working in healthcare.

review_title: Enhancing the Journey of Life for Older Adults
pros: Can practice gifting  unashamedly Faith-Based Christian Service to Older Adults through a Non-profit company
cons: Difficult to balance Self-Care with serving the persistent needs of Older Adults

review_title: If you care about seniors, Christian Care is a great place to work
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Hartford, KY
pros: Great compassion for the journey older adults - from independent living to long-term care and memory care.  Great family atmosphere and benefits.
cons: Being a non-profit, raises aren't always available.

pros: Outstanding organization!  Dedicated to enriching the lives of seniors and employees with a faith-based, caring approach.
cons: Demanding career path but being able to make a difference in others lives = worth it!

review_title: One of the greatest companies to work for
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Lexington-Fayette, KY
pros: It is such a great family atmosphere. Added to competitive pay, flexible schedule and benefits
cons: I can’t think of anything bad to say.

pros: Wonderful organization filled with compassionate individuals.
cons: The work is hard but very rewarding.
